other_tests.findings: A heterozygous nonsense mutation c3055C > T (R947X) in exon 9 of the MR gene, leading to a premature stop codon and a truncated protein with no aldosterone binding.
On admission, the index patient had hyponatremia (129 mmol/liter) and hyperkalemia (6.4 mmol/liter); subsequent plasma sodium levels remained normal (135 mmol/liter) and potassium was not specified.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Plasma sodium remained unchanged after treatment.

other_tests.findings: Plasma aldosterone was elevated (2554 pg/ml) at initial assessment.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Plasma aldosterone levels were still elevated after stopping NaCl treatment (1395 pg/ml).

other_tests.findings: Plasma renin activity was elevated on initial assessment.
Excretion of typical aldosterone metabolites (tetrahydroaldosterone and 18-hydroxy-tetrahydroaldosterone) in a 24-h urinary sample was normal.
